data.title: 10TunesOnTV
data.text:
Music-related TV listings for Feb. 28-March 6, 2005.

Mon / Tues / Wed / Thurs / Fri / Sat / Sun

MONDAY, FEB. 28

“Faith Evans Makes a Video,” MTV2

Featured artist: Faith Evans (“Again”).

“The View,” ABC

Featured artist: Ryan Cabrera (also scheduled: Joan Collins).

“American Idol,” Fox

Featured artist: Paula Abdul; male semi-finalist contestants (also scheduled: host: Ryan Seacrest, judges Simon Cowell, Randy Jackson).

“Accused: The Michael Jackson Trial,” E!

Featured artist: Michael Jackson.

“The Late Show With David Letterman,” CBS

Featured artist: Solomon Burke (also scheduled: Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson).

“The Tonight Show With Jay Leno,” NBC

Featured artist: Scissor Sisters (also scheduled: Roger Ebert, Richard Roeper).

“Jimmy Kimmel Live,” ABC

Featured artist: Duran Duran (also scheduled: Christina Ricci, Steven Bochco).

“The Late Late Show With Craig Ferguson,” CBS

Featured artist: Paul Westerberg (also scheduled: Amy Brenneman).

(Return to Top)

TUESDAY, MARCH 1

“E! News: The Michael Jackson Trial,” E!

Featured artist: Michael Jackson.

“American Idol,” Fox

Featured artist: Paula Abdul; female semi-finalist contestants (also scheduled: host: Ryan Seacrest, judges Simon Cowell, Randy Jackson).

“Nashville Star,” USA

Featured artist: LeAnn Rimes, Cledus T. Judd, Phil Vassar, Bret Michaels.

“The Late Show With David Letterman,” CBS

Featured artist: Kathleen Edwards (also scheduled: Kirstie Alley).

“The Tonight Show With Jay Leno,” NBC

Featured artist: Elton John (also scheduled: Cedric the Entertainer).

“Jimmy Kimmel Live,” ABC

Featured artist: Marc Broussard (also scheduled: George Lopez, Debbie Matenopoulos).

“Late Night With Conan O’Brien,” NBC

Featured artist: Slipknot (also scheduled: Tyra Banks).

“The Late Late Show With Craig Ferguson,” CBS

Featured artists: Judith Owen, Missy Elliott (also scheduled: Don Rickles).

“Last Call With Carson Daly,” NBC

Featured artists: Tori Amos, the Capitol Years (also scheduled: Anderson Cooper, David Witthoft).

(Return to Top)

WEDNESDAY, MARCH 2

“My Chemical Romance Makes a Video,” MTV2

Featured artist: My Chemical Romance (“Helena”).

“The Oprah Winfrey Show,” Syndicated

Featured artists: Josh Groban, Mariah Carey.

“On Stage at the Kennedy Center: The Mark Twain Prize,” PBS

Featured artists: G.E. Smith & the Saturday Night Live Band, Paul Simon (also scheduled: Lorne Michaels, Dan Aykroyd, Candice Bergen, Senator Chris Dodd, Darrell Hammond, Tiny Fey, Steve Martin, Tim Meadows, Senator John McCain, Tracy Morgan, Conan O’Brien, David Spade, Christopher Walken).

“Unique Whips: Jadakiss & the Jets,” Speed Channel

Featured artists: Jadakiss, Fat Joe (also scheduled: Anthony Becht, Jason Ferguson, Santana Moss, Jerald Sowell, Dewayne Robertson).

“The Late Show With David Letterman,” CBS

Featured artist: Amos Lee (also scheduled: Vin Diesel, Buddy Rice).

“The Tonight Show With Jay Leno,” NBC

Featured artist: 3 Doors Down (also scheduled: Gerard Butler).

“Late Night With Conan O’Brien,” NBC

Featured artist: Ben Lee.

“Last Call With Carson Daly,” NBC

Featured artists: Citizen Cope, the Capitol Years (also scheduled: Tom Arnold).

(Return to Top)

THURSDAY, MARCH 3

“Today,” NBC

Featured artist: Jennifer Lopez (also scheduled: Bebe Neuwirth).

“Live With Regis and Kelly,” Syndicated

Featured artist: Motley Crue (also scheduled: Vin Diesel).

“Making the Band 3,” MTV

Featured artist: P. Diddy (also scheduled: Johnny Wright, Phil Robinson, Laurie Ann Gibson, Doc Holiday).

“The Tonight Show With Jay Leno,” NBC

Featured artist: Lang Lang (also scheduled: Sylvester Stallone).

“Last Call With Carson Daly,” NBC

Featured artists: 22-20s, the Capitol Years (also scheduled: Drea de Matteo, Seth Meyers).

(Return to Top)

FRIDAY, MARCH 4

“Live With Regis & Kelly,” Syndicated

Featured artist: Christina Milian (also scheduled: Halle Berry).

“The Ellen DeGeneres Show,” Syndicated

Featured artist: 3 Doors Down (also scheduled: Vin Diesel, Annasophia Robb).

“Iggy Pop: Live @ The Avenue B,” Showtime Next

Featured artist: Iggy Pop.

“Jimmy Kimmel Live,” ABC

Featured artist: Silvertide (also scheduled: Tom Arnold, Michael Ealy).

“The Late Late Show With Craig Ferguson,” CBS

Featured artist: Unwritten Law (also scheduled: Jennifer Love Hewitt).

“Last Call With Carson Daly,” NBC

Featured artists: Kings Of Leon, the Capitol Years (also scheduled: John Travolta, Mark Cohen).

(Return to Top)

SATURDAY, MARCH 5

“The Saturday Early Show,” CBS

Featured artist: Billy Miles.

“Soul Train,” Syndicated

Featured artists: Mario, Lyfe.

“Grand Ole Opry Live,” Great American Country

Featured artists: Ricky Skaggs, Pat Green, the Crabb Family.

“Usher Pre-Show,” Showtime

Featured artist: Usher.

“One Night One Star Usher Live,” Showtime

Featured artist: Usher.

“Headbangers Ball,” MTV2

Featured artist: Atreyu.

“Gretchen Wilson Uncut: 60 Minutes Special,” CMT

Featured artist: Gretchen Wilson.

(Return to Top)

SUNDAY, MARCH 6

“Breakfast With the Arts: Paul McCartney in Red Square,” A&E

Featured artist: Paul McCartney.

“The Flip Wilson Show,” TV Land

Featured artist: Papa John Creach (also scheduled: Tim Conway, Joe Namath).

“All Eyes on 50 Cent: The Sequel,” MTV2

Featured artist: 50 Cent.

“MTV Unplugged: Jimmy Page & Roger Plant ‘Unledded’,” VH1 Classic

Featured artists: Jimmy Page, Robert Plant.

“50 Cent House Party,” MTV2

Featured artist: 50 Cent.

“Candy Girls,” MTV2

Featured artist: 50 Cent.

“Subterranean,” MTV2

Featured artist: Kasabian.

(Return to Top)
